decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The operation, comprising the erection of a rear roof extension with juliet balcony, would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The operation, comprising the insertion of 3 rooflights on the front roofslope, would consist of alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - The operation, comprising the erection of a single storey outbuilding, would fall within the meaning of Class E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in Class E. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE:
The applicant should be aware that the site may provide a useful habitat for swifts. Swifts are currently in decline in the UK and in order to encourage and improve the conservation of swifts the applicant is advised to consider the installation of swift nesting box/bricks on site.
description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A REAR ROOF DORMER WITH A JULIET BALCONY, INSERTION OF 3 X ROOFLIGHTS ON THE FRONT ROOF SLOPE AND ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY DETACHED OUTBUILDING IN REAR GARDEN FOR INCIDENTAL USE TO THE MAIN DWELLINGHOUSE.
